reviews.review_msg: I took GSWS 320 Friendship as a Liberatory Politic with Nerida, and it was such an amazing experience. All the readings were well curated and Nerida was very good at facilitating a great classroom discussion environment. She is one of the most compassionate professor I have ever had and if you have the opportunity to take her class, YOU SHOULD!
I found this professor to be thoughtful and engaging.  Very good.

Nerida leads such an engaging and thought-provoking class. Truly one of my favourite courses I took at SFU. She is very passionate and knowledgeable about critical studies of marriage and clearly wants her students to succeed. Would highly recommend!
This was the class I looked forward to attending each week. Lectures are interactive with lots of group discussions. Attendance was really important. She really cared about her students.

Great prof! Mary really emphasizes participation, and there will be plenty of opportunities to do so. While she may not reply emails directly, she does care for her students and gives very detailed feedback on assignments itself. You can always talk to her after class as well. Would definitely recommend taking a course with her.

Absolutely love this professor! She is truly connected to her work and explains concepts clearly. She may seem intimidating at first but once you get to know her she is really compassionate. She will go out of her way for her students. Participation and hard work are necessary but I never considered this course grueling. Highly recommend!!
